item.title: FDA Announces Plan To Cut Level Of Nicotine Allowed In Cigarettes
item.description: July 28, 2017 - The Food and Drug Administration is proposing sweeping changes to how it regulates cigarettes and related products, including reducing the amount of nicotine allowed in tobacco cigarettes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - The Food and Drug Administration is proposing sweeping changes to how it regulates cigarettes and related products, including reducing the amount of nicotine allowed in tobacco cigarettes. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/540088353/fda-announces-plan-to-cut-level-of-nicotine-allowed-in-cigarettes

item.title: From Rats To Humans, A Brain Knows When It Can't Remember
item.description: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - When we see a familiar face, we know instantly if we can remember that person's name. That's because the human brain has an ability called metamemory. Looks like rats may have that higher power, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/28/539761740/from-rats-to-humans-a-brain-knows-when-it-cant-remember

item.title: Charlie Gard, Baby Whose Parents Battled Hospital Over Treatment, Dies
item.description: July 28, 2017 - Charlie had a severe genetic disorder with no known cure, and doctors said experimental treatments could cause suffering. He died in a hospice after his parents dropped a legal challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - Charlie had a severe genetic disorder with no known cure, and doctors said experimental treatments could cause suffering. He died in a hospice after his parents dropped a legal challenge. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540033758/charlie-gard-baby-whose-parents-battled-hospital-over-treatment-dies

item.title: Congress Emerges From Another Health Care Failure Without A Clear Path Forward
item.description: July 28, 2017 - Whether Republicans will try to resurrect health care efforts — again — is uncertain. Republican Sen. John McCain, who cast the decisive no vote, said the bill's defeat is a chance to "start fresh."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - Whether Republicans will try to resurrect health care efforts — again — is uncertain. Republican Sen. John McCain, who cast the decisive no vote, said the bill's defeat is a chance to "start fresh." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/540021021/congress-emerges-from-another-health-care-failure-without-a-clear-path-forward

item.title: Dutch-Led Fund Raises $300 Million To Replace U.S. Funding For Sexual Health
item.description: July 28, 2017 - In March, the "She Decides" initiative announced $190 million for charities that would lose U.S. support under the Trump administration's anti-abortion policy. Since then, money has kept pouring in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - In March, the "She Decides" initiative announced $190 million for charities that would lose U.S. support under the Trump administration's anti-abortion policy. Since then, money has kept pouring in. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/539991817/dutch-led-fund-raises-300-million-to-replace-u-s-funding-for-sexual-health

item.title: FDA Wants To Lower Nicotine In Tobacco Cigarettes
item.description: July 28, 2017 - The FDA announces a new approach to regulating the amount of nicotine in tobacco cigarettes. NPR's Rob Stein tells Rachel Martin that research shows there may be a non-addictive level of nicotine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - The FDA announces a new approach to regulating the amount of nicotine in tobacco cigarettes. NPR's Rob Stein tells Rachel Martin that research shows there may be a non-addictive level of nicotine. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/540019945/fda-wants-to-lower-nicotine-in-tobacco-cigarettes

item.title: FDA Proposes Cutting Nicotine Amounts In Cigarettes, Targeting Addiction
item.description:
July 28, 2017 - It would be the first time in the agency's history that it has sought to regulate the amount of nicotine in cigarettes.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540012363/fda-proposes-cutting-nicotine-amounts-in-cigarettes
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - It would be the first time in the agency's history that it has sought to regulate the amount of nicotine in cigarettes. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540012363/fda-proposes-cutting-nicotine-amounts-in-cigarettes

item.title: Gov. John Hickenlooper On Democrats' Plans For Health Care
item.description: July 28, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks with Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper of Colorado about what Democrats plan to do after Senate Republicans failed to pass their latest health care bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks with Democratic Gov. John Hickenlooper of Colorado about what Democrats plan to do after Senate Republicans failed to pass their latest health care bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/539961510/gov-john-hickenlooper-on-democrats-plans-for-health-care

item.title: For Decades These Caregivers Helped Patients, Families Through Illness And Death
item.description: July 28, 2017 - When the Rev. Noel Hickie and Marcia Hilton began working in hospice care, neither was sure they were cut out for the job. But they realized they could help families process grief and make things OK.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - When the Rev. Noel Hickie and Marcia Hilton began working in hospice care, neither was sure they were cut out for the job. But they realized they could help families process grief and make things OK. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/28/539726037/for-decades-these-caregivers-helped-patients-families-through-illness-and-death

item.title: Repeal-And-Replace Effort In Senate Still Dominated By Confusion
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Republicans headed into an all-night session in an uncomfortable position where the only legislation they can potentially pass is a bill most senators oppose.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Republicans headed into an all-night session in an uncomfortable position where the only legislation they can potentially pass is a bill most senators oppose. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539850088/repeal-and-replace-effort-in-senate-still-dominated-by-confusion

item.title: Montana Governor Says Why He Signed Letter To Reject Health Care Law
item.description: July 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Governor of Montana, Democrat Steve Bullock, about a bipartisan letter he signed to with his colleagues to oppose the "skinny repeal" of the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Governor of Montana, Democrat Steve Bullock, about a bipartisan letter he signed to with his colleagues to oppose the "skinny repeal" of the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539825397/montana-governor-explains-why-he-signed-letter-to-reject-healthcare-law

item.title: Senate Republicans Continue Effort To Pass Health Care Law
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Senate Majority leader Mitch McConnell forced Republicans to take a vote on a measure that would have repealed parts of Obamacare and saw that effort fail. The Senate will continue those efforts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Senate Majority leader Mitch McConnell forced Republicans to take a vote on a measure that would have repealed parts of Obamacare and saw that effort fail. The Senate will continue those efforts. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539825390/republicans-in-the-senate-continue-effort-to-pass-health-care-law

item.title: Slug Slime Inspires Scientists To Invent Sticky Surgical Glue
item.description: July 27, 2017 - The words "strong" and "inspiring" are not usually assigned to garden slugs. But slug slime inspired materials scientists to invent a new kind of adhesive that could one day help heal human wounds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - The words "strong" and "inspiring" are not usually assigned to garden slugs. But slug slime inspired materials scientists to invent a new kind of adhesive that could one day help heal human wounds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/27/539473673/slug-slime-inspires-scientists-to-invent-sticky-surgical-glue

item.title: Terminally Ill Baby Charlie Gard Will Move To Hospice Care To Die
item.description: July 27, 2017 - A British judge has approved a plan to transfer Charlie, who has a rare genetic disorder with no known cure, to a hospice facility. His life support will be withdrawn shortly after the transfer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - A British judge has approved a plan to transfer Charlie, who has a rare genetic disorder with no known cure, to a hospice facility. His life support will be withdrawn shortly after the transfer. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/27/539754960/terminally-ill-baby-charlie-gard-will-move-to-hospice-care-to-die

item.title: Is It Time To Sack Football As We Know It?
item.description:
July 27, 2017 - A new study of 111 brains of former NFL players revealed that 110 of them had a degenerative brain disease called chronic traumatic encephalopathy.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-27/is-it-time-to-sack-football-as-we-know-it
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
